titles.title: A bill to make technical corrections in the Anabolic Steroid Control Act of 2004.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Energy and Commerce
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

bill.summary: 4/25/2005--Passed Senate without amendment. Makes technical corrections to amendments made by the Anabolic Steroid Control Act of 2004 regarding names of substances included in the definition of "anabolic steroid" under the Controlled Substances Act.
